Section.Label: Chapter_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_Section_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_of_global_functions
Section.Heading: UnitalSZ automatic generated documentation of global functions

ManSection.Returns: true if bmat is the blist list of an abstract unital.
ManSection.Description: Each row of bmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks.

ManSection.Returns: true if bmat is the blist list of an abstract unital.
ManSection.Description: Each row of bmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong bmat matrix size drops error.

ManSection.Returns: true if incmat is the incidence matrix of an abstract unital.
ManSection.Description: Each row of incmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong incmat matrix size drops error.

ManSection.Returns: true if blocklist is the list of blocks of an abstract unital.
ManSection.Description: We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong number of blocks or wrong number of points (union of the blocks in blocklist) drops error.

ManSection.Returns: The unital object corresponding to the blist list bmat.
The unital object corresponding to the blist list bmat.
ManSection.Description: Each row of bmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong bmat matrix size drops error. The function stores bmat and sets the Order of the unital.

ManSection.Returns: The unital object corresponding to the list of blocks blocklist. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong number of blocks or wrong number of points (union of the blocks in blocklist) drops error. The function stores bmat, which is based on blocklist, sets the Order of the unital and sets the names of the points, PointNamesOfUnital of the unital.
The unital object corresponding to the incidence matrix incmat.
ManSection.Description: Each row of incmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong incmat matrix size drops error. The function stores bmat, which is based on incmat and sets the Order of the unital.

ManSection.Returns: The classical unital object, which is the abstract unital of order q isomorphic to the Hermitian curve in the classical projective plane.
ManSection.Description: The Hermitian curve has the following canonical equation: X_0^{q + 1} + X_1^{q + 1} + X_2^{q + 1} = 0. The function computes the blocks of the unital with the help of PGU(3,q) and calls AbstractUnitalByDesignBlocks. The Name of the unital is set as HermitianAbstractUnital(q).

ManSection.Returns: The list of boolean incidence matrices of size (q^3 + 1) \times q^2(q^2 - q + 1) read from filename.
ManSection.Description: The file filename must be gzipped and must contain nr matrices of dimension mentioned above. The matrices must be 0-1 matrices without any whitespace between the entries in one row and there must not be any empty lines between matrices.
Reads in the incidence matrices from the libraries of unitals shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 3 of the unitals by Betten, Betten and Tonchev.
ManSection.Description: In the paper Unitals and codes by Anton Betten, Dieter Betten and Vladimir D. Tonchev (Discrete Mathematics 267, 2003, 23-33.) 909 unitals of order 3 were constructed. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 4 of the unitals by Krčadinac, Nakić and Pavčević.
ManSection.Description: In the paper The Kramer-Mesner method with tactical decompositions: some new unitals on 65 points by Vedran Krčadinac, Anamari Nakić and Mario Osvin Pavčević (Journal of Combinatorial Designs 19, 2011, 290-303.) 1777 unitals of order 4 were constructed. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 3 of the unitals by Krčadinac.
ManSection.Description: In the paper Steiner 2-designs S(2, 4, 28) with nontrivial automorphisms by Vedran Krčadinac (Glasnik Matematički, Vol. 37 (57), 2002, 259-268.) 4466 unitals of order 3 were constructed. This library contains all the unitals of order 3 with nontrivial automorphism group. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.
The function prints the information about the available libraries of unitals.

Section.Label: Chapter_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_Section_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_of_attributes
Section.Heading: UnitalSZ automatic generated documentation of attributes

ManSection.Returns: The range [ 1..q^3 + 1 ].
ManSection.Description: If u is a unital of order q, then u has q^3 + 1 points.

ManSection.Returns: The blocks of the unital u.
ManSection.Description: If u is a unital of order q, then each block is a subset of the points of the unital with q + 1 points. The blocks of an abstract unital form a 2-(q^3+1,q+1,1) design.

ManSection.Returns: The names of the q^3+1 points of u.
ManSection.Description: The names of the points of u is a list of length q^3+1 of arbitrary &GAP; objects. It may be set by SetPointNamesOfUnital. The default is the range [ 1..q^3 + 1 ].

ManSection.Returns: The (bipartite) digraph constructed from the boolean incidence matrix bmat of the unital u.
The automorphism group of the unital u.
ManSection.Description: The function computes the automorphism group of u with the help of its incidence digraph.

ManSection.Returns: The list of records r containing the fields r.block1, r.block2, r.fullpts, where r.fullpts is the set of full point of u w.r.t. the blocks r.block1, r.block2. The returned list contains all possible full points of u.
ManSection.Description: The point P is a full point of the unital U w.r.t. the blocks b_1,b_2 if P is not contained in b_1 or b_2, and, the projection with center P from b_1 to b_2 is a well-defined bijection.

ManSection.Returns: A list of records of full points of u up to the automorphism group of u. In other words, if P is a full point w.r.t. the blocks b_1,b_2, then there is an automorphism \alpha of U such that P^\alpha, b_1^\alpha, b_2^\alpha are in the list.

The list of records r containing the fields r.block1, r.block2, r.fullpts, r.gens, where r.fullpts is the set of full point of u w.r.t. the blocks r.block1, r.block2. The field r.gens contains the permutations defined by the projections from one block to the other with center of the full points.
ManSection.Description: The permutations in r.gens are constructed the following way: first we project b_1 to b_2 with center P, where P is the first element of the list of full points. Then we take all projections from b_2 to b_1 with center Q, where Q ranges through the list of full points. All these projections define a permutation on b_1, since the projections were well-defined bijections.

Section.Label: Chapter_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_Section_UnitalSZ_automatic_generated_documentation_of_methods
Section.Heading: UnitalSZ automatic generated documentation of methods

ManSection.Returns: An isomorphism between the unitals u1 and u1 if they are isomorphic, and fail otherwise.
ManSection.Description: The isomorphism is a permutation which sends the points of the unital u1 to the points of the unital u2 such that the it preserves the incidence between the points and the blocks. The function computes the isomorphism with the help of the incidence digraphs of the unitals u1 and u2.
